channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Border Patrol has a history of excessive force. Critics say they're out of their depth
item.description: People who study the Border Patrol say it continues to be less well prepared than big city police for handling crowds and situations involving protesters, some of whom are legally armed.
item.content:encoded: People who study the Border Patrol say it continues to be less well prepared than big city police for handling crowds and situations involving protesters, some of whom are legally armed.
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: The long tradition of U.S. interference in Venezuela
item.description: The U.S.'s latest involvement in Venezuela's government is part of a long tradition of U.S. interference – from economic sanctions to covert operations to overthrow governments – in that region.
item.content:encoded: The U.S.'s latest involvement in Venezuela's government is part of a long tradition of U.S. interference – from economic sanctions to covert operations to overthrow governments – in that region.
item.dc:creator: Gene Demby

item.title: Myanmar finishes the final phase of its election, which critics call a sham
item.description: Myanmar completed its third and final round of voting on Sunday in a monthlong general election called by the ruling military junta — an election that critics call a sham.
item.content:encoded: Myanmar completed its third and final round of voting on Sunday in a monthlong general election called by the ruling military junta — an election that critics call a sham.
item.dc:creator: Michael Sullivan

item.title: Here to Help: In Baton Rouge, kids get a free and safe place to go after school
item.description: A poor neighborhood in Baton Rouge, La., has a volunteer initiative that's making a difference for the children there.
item.content:encoded: A poor neighborhood in Baton Rouge, La., has a volunteer initiative that's making a difference for the children there.
item.dc:creator: Alex Cox

item.title: Trump and Walz strike conciliatory tone in wake of second Minnesota killing
item.description: The Trump administration is working to reframe the narrative in Minneapolis on enforcing the law after outrage over killings continues.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is working to reframe the narrative in Minneapolis on enforcing the law after outrage over killings continues.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Neighbors and church members transformed the home of a man with terminal cancer
item.description: In 2007, Larry Maxfield helped his brother Marty move to Utah. Marty had terminal cancer. Neighbors and church members helped transform Marty's new house into a warm home during his final days.
item.content:encoded: In 2007, Larry Maxfield helped his brother Marty move to Utah. Marty had terminal cancer. Neighbors and church members helped transform Marty's new house into a warm home during his final days.

item.title: Fight over DHS funding has the government on track for a partial shutdown
item.description: Efforts in Congress to avoid a partial government shutdown have been scrambled by two fatal shootings in Minneapolis this month involving ICE officers.
item.content:encoded: Efforts in Congress to avoid a partial government shutdown have been scrambled by two fatal shootings in Minneapolis this month involving ICE officers.
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: A year after the DCA midair collision, families of those killed push for changes
item.description: Nearly a year after the midair collision over the Potomac River, family members of the victims are still pushing for tougher restrictions in the congested airspace around the nation's capital.
item.content:encoded: Nearly a year after the midair collision over the Potomac River, family members of the victims are still pushing for tougher restrictions in the congested airspace around the nation's capital.
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Alex Pretti remembered as friend, nurse and dog dad
item.description: Two days after VA nurse Alex Pretti was fatally shot by federal agents, we learn more about who he was from his friend.
item.content:encoded: Two days after VA nurse Alex Pretti was fatally shot by federal agents, we learn more about who he was from his friend.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Are snow days bad for students?
item.description: If you have ever experienced the giddy freedom of a snow day, you are not alone. But while most kids love the days off, is there an impact on academic performance?
item.content:encoded: If you have ever experienced the giddy freedom of a snow day, you are not alone. But while most kids love the days off, is there an impact on academic performance?
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly
